comments.content: Looks custom to me and /s looks even weird among the others. If I have to recreate it and even if it sounds "crazy", I'd probably start from [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724120357/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/eurostile) (mainly beacause of this /s) redrawing almost all letters from /o. An effortless solution would be to start from [Age](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724120357/http:/fontfabric.com/age-free-font) and borrow /s from Eurostile.
